bibl.title: Letter from Wade Hampton Frost to Laura Armistead Carter, March 13, 1929

div1.p: Frost wants to schedule a time to meet to go over Carter's final bibliographic revisions.

div1.head: Letter from Wade Hampton Frost to Laura Armistead Carter, March 13, 1929
div1.opener:
Book. Bibliography
Frost
THE JOHNS HOPKINS UNIVERSITY
SCHOOL OF HYGIENE AND PUBLIC HEALTH
615 NORTH WOLFE STREET
DEPARTMENT OF EPIDEMIOLOGY
BALTIMORE, MD.
March 13, 1929.
Miss Laura A. Carter,
The Westmoreland Apartments,
2122 California Street, N.W.
Washington, D.C.
My dear Miss Laura:
div1.p:
I congratulate you on being able to say “finis”
to your work on revision of bibliographic cards and
hope you will make this the occasion for taking a
really good well-earned rest.

If it is at all possible to achieve it, I would
like very much to take up my further work on the MS.
the first of next week, but I feel that it is hardly
worth while for me to do so unless and until I can see
a fair period of at least a week or ten days ahead.
Just at present that much freedom from other work is
not apparent on the horizon, but I hope it will not be
long coming into sight. As soon as it does, I will
assuredly call for you.

I do not see any free time during this present
week, and as I have indicated above, I cannot confidently
predict it for next week. However, it is reasonably
certain that sometime next week I can find at least
one or two days which are free and if it would be agree-
able to you, it might perhaps be better to ask you to
come over then to spend say two days with me, merely
getting all the bibliographical material together in
good order for the final revision in editing. This
would, I think, be a help to me and would have a further
virtue of freeing your mind for a while. Is it likely
that it would be agreeable to you? I would suggest
this week-end but fear that I will be tied up just then
and also think it likely that Susan will be taking that
time for a long contemplated trip to Charlottesville.
With best regards and more congratulations,
div1.closer: Sincerely yours, W. H. F. whf/f
